You can still get a great workout at home with minimal equipment. Here are some effective bodyweight exercises and resistance band exercises that you can do at home:

**Bodyweight Exercises:**

1. **Squats:** Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hands by your sides. Lower your body down into a squat, keeping your back straight and knees behind your toes. Push through your heels to return to standing.
2. **Push-ups:** Start in a plank position with your hands shoulder-width apart and feet hip-width apart. Lower your body down until your chest almost touches the ground, then push back up to the starting position.
3. **Lunges:** Stand with your feet together and take a large step forward with one foot. Lower your body down into a lunge, keeping your front knee bent at a 90-degree angle and back knee almost touching the ground. Push through your front heel to return to standing. Alternate legs with each rep.
4. **Planks:** Start in a plank position with your hands shoulder-width apart and feet hip-width apart. Hold this position for 30-60 seconds, engaging your core muscles and keeping your body straight.
5. **Dips (using a chair or bench):** Sit on the edge of a chair or bench with your hands gripping the edge and your feet flat on the floor. Lower your body down by bending your elbows until your arms are bent at a 90-degree angle. Straighten your arms to return to the starting position.
6. **Burpees:** Start in a standing position, then drop down into a squat position and place your hands on the ground. From there, kick your feet back into a plank position, do a push-up, then quickly return your feet to the squat position. Stand up from the squat position to complete the rep.
7. **Mountain climbers:** Start in a plank position, then bring one knee up towards your chest and quickly switch to the other knee, mimicking the motion of running.
8. **Tricep dips (using a door):** Stand in a doorway with your hands gripping the doorframe at shoulder height. Lower your body down by bending your elbows until your arms are bent at a 90-degree angle. Straighten your arms to return to the starting position.

**Resistance Band Exercises:**

1. **Bicep curls:** Hold a resistance band in both hands with your palms facing forward. Curl your arms up towards your shoulders, keeping your upper arms still, then lower back down to the starting position.
2. **Tricep extensions:** Hold a resistance band in one hand with your arm extended overhead and your palm facing forward. Lower your hand behind your head, keeping your upper arm still, then raise back up to the starting position. Alternate arms with each rep.
3. **Chest press:** Hold a resistance band in both hands at shoulder height with your palms facing forward. Press the band away from your body, extending your arms fully, then lower back down to the starting position.
4. **Rows:** Hold a resistance band in one hand with your arm extended in front of you and your palm facing towards your body. Pull the band towards your chest, keeping your elbow close to your body, then lower back down to the starting position. Alternate arms with each rep.
5. **Shoulder rotations:** Hold a resistance band in both hands at shoulder height with your palms facing down. Rotate your shoulders in a circular motion, first clockwise and then counterclockwise.

**Tips and Reminders:**

* Start with lower reps and sets and gradually increase as you build strength and endurance.
* Focus on proper form and technique over the number of reps or weight used.
* Rest for 30-60 seconds between sets and 60-90 seconds between exercises.
* Warm up before starting your workout and cool down afterwards to prevent injury.
* Make sure to listen to your body and rest when needed.
